definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: The bathroom fixtures are accessible via the washing table and shower cabin.
sentences.chinese: 该浴室通过洗手台和淋浴房轻松固定。

sentences.english: I need a new bathroom sink faucet .
sentences.chinese: 我需要一个新的浴室洗手台的水龙头。

sentences.english: Because they can't reach the sink.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们够不到洗手台。

sentences.english: Nikki : sorry! Am I hogging on the suite?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我霸占了洗手台吗？

sentences.english: In the camps, more latrines must be built, as well as hand-washing stations at the latrines.
sentences.chinese: 在难民营区，必须多建便坑，还要在便坑搭设洗手台。

sentences.english: As long as wash one's hands time of door before the stage shut the illicit close sex that can assure toilet.
sentences.chinese: 只要把洗手台前的趟门关上就可保证卫生间的私密性。

sentences.english: The pipe under the bathroom sink was jammed by a huge clot of hair.
sentences.chinese: 浴室洗手台下的水管被一大团头发塞阻塞。

definition: chamber pot/wooden pan used as toilet/toilet bowl
washbowl/basin for washing hands and face
